Posts.Content: sloth wrote: Hello Im the one who had a respratory infection and had to delay my surgery for bloody nipple drainage and inflamed duct..am to have a ductogram and ductal excision. I was on steroids for several weeks and strong antibiotics for a month...well the drainage is now almost clear and hardly perceptable, its amber clear at worst and thats way diff then it was and its not coming out by itself anymore. Im sorta upset because I had to call this surgeons office back eventually and finally did and the stupid scheduler got all huffy w/ me when I asked her a question. I asked since I was on steroids which reduce inflamation (the duct) and strong antibiotics could it be I dont need this done now? I cant afford to go thru w/ it if its not ness. She gets all p o'd and puts the doctor on the phone who gets even more snotty w/ me ! I was very nice polite and just said should we repeat and u.s. to verify the inflamation is still there? The surgeon said I dont know why youre having such a hard time understanding me this needs done (what one question is a problem!) if you have any fluid still..(my thyroid doc said clear basic drainage can be from my thyroid and I told doc this at prev appt.)She went on to lecture me she doesnt do uness surgery she isnt the type. I tried to tell her I wasnt saying that at all I just thought the meds maybe changed it all and she hasnt seen me so I thought Id ask. I just dont like how she treated me and they are making me feel like a problem, I did cancel once from the bronchitis and they have had to wait but geez. Wasnt it a perfectly good question? Dont woman get infections that antibiotics and prednisone couldve cleared up? I may call her tomorrow when im supposed to confirm and tell them to forget it. What would it hurt to wait and see and then I will have to go elsewhere I guess. Thanks for input and reading me its so good to have somewhere to go about this...its been so long since the emotional upset of hearing I had this problem to now Im just sick of thinking about it and upset I guess. After thinking about why this bothered me maybe I dont want to think if" Id have cancer I have to hear it from this person who is so cold and that wont be a time I want to take time to find a diff' surgeon, do I really want someone who treats me like that doing my mastecomy (if Id need one)? Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: sloth wrote: Hello I have a dilema and wondered if anyone out there has any experience w/ this at all?? I have had to delay my ductal excisional biopsy for nipple bleeding and inflamed duct because I have bad asthma and allergies and am going thru' a bad period I cant shake w/ allergies. (iv sedation only w/ surgery) The doctor had to give me a cortisone (kenalog) shot at a one half normal dose to help me. The oral prednisone was killing my stomach and I still needed the meds. The immunologist/asthma doc says get the surgery you need it done and its been since early december I found blood. He says I will be fine and its such a low released dose I will heal fine. (he said simply dont tell the surgeon!?) Problem is if I tell the surgeon she wont do it. I have to sign things saying i disclosed all Im uncomfortable lieing. Is there much danger to having the surgery after the cortisone shot it will have been several weeks later but it stays in body for months. Thanks for any input Im so tired to death of thinking of all this I want it over. Log in to post a reply

I mean isnt it plausible human error when labeling slides could occur? Anyone out there know lab protocol how easy would this be? With such a serious issue I dont think its unusual to wonder? Posts.Content: sloth wrote: Hi Ever since I had to cancel my ductal excision at my current surgeons office they are dragging their feet at resched' my surgery. The sched' nurse wants me to be certain I wont cancel again, not being psychic I cant tell them that, I have severe asthma and its flu season. I get pnumonia really easy. I guess its a money thing or a theyre paranoid about my health and dont want sued, not that I would anyway. I will go elsewhere but I have no references and Ive had crappy luck w/ out ref's on docs. This one came highly recc'md and there isnt a lot of selection at this hospital I will have to go out of town next time. I will call yet again next week and ask her point blank do they want me to go somewhere else but they prob cant say yes legally. I wish they would be straight and stop putting me off I need this over with. Its been a week and half since we spoke last (the scheduler and I) she hasnt called back to schedule like she said she would. We played phone tag before that. Any ideas? Cancer societies only have lists no real references, Im not too social so Ive no one to ask locally. Thanks again ;O) Log in to post a reply

Im soo upset stressed want surgery now not later! sloth missz

Posts.Content: sloth wrote: Hi Im the one who had nipple drainage that appeared and is bloody (its now amber clearish but blood tested). I had bronchitis all winter and a surgeon wouldnt touch me, now finally I have a doc with excellent credentials IE: references from patients my sister met. Well it took forever to get in to see her and forever to get on her surgery schedule. Im sooo wanting this darn surgery over the stress of worrying about this all these months has me at wits end. I keep giving it to God and then I yank it back if you know what I mean Well apparantly this surgeon was in the process of getting clearance for surgery for me from my asthma doc (why cant I take responsibility I know when my asthma is bad he shouldnt have to take liability for my her surgery), and he didnt get back to her till last week and she called to talk w/ him multiple times since last month! Now he wont approve it till I see him, fine but why didnt asthma docs call and tell me this before now! My surgery is sched for june 7. If I go in this internist office and catch a cold like I often do...there goes surgery again..Im crying now...I cant stand the thought of them cancelling me yet again! And my breast is sore now in a spot it wasnt and its not hormonal. Im scared out my wits and want this over! Im stressing about the debt the co pays are putting us in and on top of that they are laying off at hubbys work, we cant afford cobra insurance not even a little bit could we. We are praying he has enough senority to stay on. I know they "cant" fire him for using insurance too much but it happens and they just cover it up I know. Cancer treatments cost a lot ...what if they find out and cut his job! UGH!! Im taking a breath I mean what will be will be but geez! I mean who waits six months to get bloody discharge checked! (it wasnt by choice but still) If they resched' me Im going to blow my top! Ya know what really burns me is this internist asthma doc is who I depend on to give info to a crisis doc I may see, he knows me long history, I dont see others. If it was this hard to get this info for her (surgeon) what will it be in the future needs!? Im afraid to complain to him, I mean is this even his problem (my surgery). signed...one upset sloth! (Im sorry, there are those here w/ much bigger problems then my whine...but I dont really know where else to talk about this w/ those who know) Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: sloth wrote: Hi everyone I did a search here but nothing specific came up... Im sorry I dont mean to whine...I just am curious how long is normal for nipple pain after a ductal excision? It looks great very healthy I mean all things considered, steri strips havent come off (told to let em' come off alone) I am showering w/ them. I just wondered if its normal healing to have pain in the nipple 11 days out? (its not unbearable but is sore) Its the small semi circle cut around nipple area. Also a small cut above for second sample looks fine tho'. I dont see my doc again for ten days more yet. Thanks everyone Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: sloth wrote: Im thrilled to have finally found a nice doc who seems great but...I got a report from the updated ultra sound they did at her university at appt' and it said everything appears normal no cancer signs. Okay...if the ducts are no longer inflamed and filled then what exactly is the surgery target? They used to be inflamed. (mammo was clear from day one) I wanna trust her I do, but I dont want her free digging exactly. I had very dark bloody drainage for a few months, now its clear amber but still does test for blood but no longer comes out on its own. So how does it work, has anyone had surgery w/ only drainage as the target??? I want to do the right thing I just think its a good question...whats the target for sample? Im just confused...I do have a call in to her and they were nice and said she will call but it may be a week she is really booked. Thanks again everyone youre awesome! Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: sloth wrote: Hi everyone..I felt it important to tell everyone who supported me here and or read my posts that my results came in today ..and they are B9 But somehow I feel bad heralding it here as so many of you who comfort are going thru maignancies. Thank you doesnt seem enough to tell you how very very helpful it is that you all take the time to be here and reply!!! ((hugs of thanks and encouragement)) to all of you! My tests showed yet another papilloma and a duct showing desplasia but not the cancerous sort. Id imagine it puts me in the high risk catagory, w/ my mom and all and my past biopsy cell changes. But for now Im clear. My mom kinda upset me she was happy and said" I hope youre done w/ this now and dont go getting more mammograms and things?" I was like...what? Apparantly she couldnt take the stress of my issues. I didnt find this on mammogram anyway, my nipple was bleeding for petes sake. Sigh. I need encouraged to go back for check ups because we are financially strained (no one helps I wont take it thats not what mom meant). And everytime I go they biopsy me and its hard w/ my other health issues. So itd be easy not to go back I dont need to be discouraged not to go back! Anyway...sorry Im whining Im very grateful for the results and so thankful for your support ..prayers and thoughts! Sincerely...sloth Log in to post a reply
